description: Temporary 5-year use of 256 Green Lanes as a hand car wash (Sui Generis).
subdivision_of_building: There are no existing buildings on-site; however, the proposal does cover the whole existing site.
decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-6b5b4048-7fff-f8bc-04a3-6d1e20ef2b83"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposal fails to demonstrate that there has been any active marketing at the site or that it is not suitable or viable for any other forms of social infrastructure needed in the locality. In the absence of this marking evidence or justification, the proposed change of use would fail to be in accordance with policy LP8 of Hackney’s LP33 (2020) and policy S1 of the London Plan (2021)</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-e8c87d9a-7fff-3a85-439e-77ca0eb12f45"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposed temporary change of use to a car wash for five years would fail to be in accordance with the long-term housing needs of this allocated site and therefore fail to be in accordance with site allocation MH3 and policies LP12 (Meeting Housing Needs and Locations for New Homes) and LP13 (Affordable Housing) of Hackney’s LP33 (2020).</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-72567a58-7fff-9ac4-1114-41d156e7f977"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">In the absence of a full Travel Plan or sufficiently detailed Transport Statement, the proposed change of use to a car wash for a 5-year period would fail to promote walking and cycling within the site’s local environment and would fail to reduce the dominance of the car. It would also create an unacceptable level of severance cycle and pedestrian route with insufficient mitigation.&nbsp; It would therefore fail to be in accordance with policies LP41 (Liveable Neighbourhoods), LP42 (Walking and Cycling), and LP43 (Transport and Development) of Hackney’s LP33 (2020) and policies T1 (Strategic approach to Transport), T2 (Healthy Streets) and T4 (Assessing and mitigating transport imaacts) of The&nbsp;London Plan (2021).</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"> </span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7b1a6d3c-7fff-76a8-829c-01e258183f41"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 5.75pt 0pt 5.75pt;"><span id="docs-internal-guid-d5448686-7fff-c7cd-cce4-01b0ca840b9f"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 5.75pt 0pt 5.75pt;"><span id="docs-internal-guid-56c2b6c9-7fff-9453-bf0b-22dc883f324d"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;text-align: justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 5.75pt 0pt 5.75pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">In the absence of a Biodiversity Net Gain (BNG) Statement or calculations, the proposal fails to demonstrate how it meets&nbsp;the Biodiversity Gain (Town and Country Planning) (Modifications and Amendments) (England) Regulations 2024.</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-42e350d1-7fff-a240-0708-30b79bca1b4a"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">In the absence of a satisfactory acoustic survey, and the proximity of neighbouring residential properties, the proposed use as a car wash for a 5-year period would have an unacceptable amenity impact in terms of noise and disturbance from the proposed machinery, in particular, the car wash jet hand pumps, and other human activities associated with this type of use. It would therefore fail to be in accordance with policy LP2 (Development and Amenity)&nbsp;of Hackney’s LP33 (2020) policy D14 (Noise) of The London Plan (2021).</span></p>
